sentence: I would like to welcome everyone to the inaugural Community Banking Research and Policy Conference, co-sponsored by the Federal Reserve System and the Conference of State Bank Supervisors (CSBS).
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it pertains to the introduction of a conference on community banking research and policy, without providing any indication of the stance or implications on monetary policy.

sentence: I particularly want to thank the Federal Reserve and CSBS staff members who worked hard to organize this event.

sentence: By bringing together community bankers, bank regulators, and researchers from academic institutions and government agencies, the conference will help us all to better understand the issues that are most important to the future of community banking.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses a conference aimed at enhancing understanding of community banking issues, without any direct mention or implications of hawkish, dovish, or neutral stances on monetary policy.

sentence: Although firm plans have not yet been made, I do hope this will be the first of many joint Federal Reserve System and CSBS conferences that focus on community banking research and policy.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the possibility of future conferences on community banking research and policy, without providing any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance towards monetary policy.

sentence: The U.S. banking system has undergone significant consolidation over the past two decades or so, with very large banking organizations increasing their market shares.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the consolidation of the U.S. banking system and the increase in market shares of large banking organizations. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Nevertheless, community banks (which we typically define as banking institutions with assets of $10 billion or less) continue to provide vital financial services to households, small businesses, and small farms in communities across America.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the role of community banks in providing financial services to households, small businesses, and small farms. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Community banking is fundamentally a local, relationship-based business.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the nature of community banking, which does not directly impact the monetary policy stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC).

sentence: Community bankers live in the localities they serve; their customers are their neighbors and friends.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the relationship between community bankers and their customers, without providing any indication of the stance or implications on monetary policy.

sentence: Their direct, personal knowledge of the local economy enables them to tailor products and services to meet their communities' needs.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the ability of individuals to customize products and services based on their understanding of the local economy, which does not directly impact the stance of monetary policy.

sentence: They can look beyond credit scores and other model-based metrics to make lending decisions in part based on more qualitative information that large regional or national financial institutions are less well suited to consider.
reason: This sentence suggests a dovish stance on US monetary policy as it emphasizes the importance of considering qualitative information in lending decisions, rather than solely relying on model-based metrics. It implies a willingness to adopt a more flexible and accommodating approach, potentially prioritizing economic growth over strict regulations.

sentence: Community bankers recognize that their own success depends on the health of the communities they serve, which is why so many community bankers contribute locally as citizens and leaders as well as in their capacities as lenders and providers of financial services.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the role of community bankers in contributing to the health of their communities. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: The photos that you see around the conference center do a very nice job of capturing the spirit of community banking and illustrating the contributions of community bankers.

sentence: Although community banks have some natural advantages, such as local knowledge and relationships, they also face significant challenges.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the advantages and challenges faced by community banks, which do not directly impact the monetary policy stance of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC).

sentence: As battle-scarred survivors of a financial crisis and deep recession, community bankers today confront a frustratingly slow recovery, stiff competition from larger banks and other financial institutions, and the responsibility of complying with new and existing regulations.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on the challenges faced by community bankers in the aftermath of a financial crisis and recession, rather than providing any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: My colleagues at the Federal Reserve and I understand these concerns, and we are committed to crafting supervisory policies and regulations that are appropriately scaled to banks' size and complexity.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it focuses on crafting supervisory policies and regulations for banks' size and complexity, rather than indicating a stance on interest rates or the overall direction of monetary policy.

sentence: And we have confidence that the remarkable resilience of America's community bankers will enable them not only to survive, but also to thrive in the years ahead.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any information or implications related to the stance of monetary policy. It focuses on the resilience and future prospects of America's community bankers, which is unrelated to the monetary policy stance being hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: The best way to understand the challenges that community bankers face is to talk to the bankers themselves, and we at the Federal Reserve do that regularly.

sentence: For example, to ensure that we remain mindful of the unique characteristics of community banks, the Federal Reserve Board established the Community Depository Institutions Advisory Council.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the establishment of the Community Depository Institutions Advisory Council, which focuses on community banks and does not directly impact the overall monetary policy stance.

sentence: To make that connection, we also established a subcommittee of the Board that reviews all regulatory and supervisory proposals for their potential effects on community banks.

sentence: I hope those efforts are helping community bankers avoid spending time trying to understand rules that do not apply to them.

sentence: One of the strengths of the Federal Reserve System is the quality of the research done by our economists and other professionals.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it does not provide any indication or implications regarding the stance of the Federal Reserve. It simply highlights the strength of the research conducted by economists and professionals within the Federal Reserve System.

sentence: The research we do on community banking helps guide our thinking on regulatory matters and on broader economic trends.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the research on community banking, which does not directly impact the decision-making process of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) regarding interest rates or other monetary policy tools.

sentence: In particular, the Board's subcommittee on community banking is regularly briefed on relevant research being conducted across the System.

sentence: Thus, research findings inform policy, and policy concerns guide research.

sentence: In fact, after learning about several research projects, the subcommittee suggested that the staff hold a community banking research conference--a suggestion that brought all of us to St. Louis today.

sentence: The first research session this afternoon will focus on the role of community banks in our financial and economic system.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the research session's focus on community banks in the financial and economic system, without providing any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance.

sentence: Papers in this session examine whether community banks influence new-firm survival, whether equipment finance is a potential growth area for community banks, how community bank failures affect local economic performance, and whether community bank lending relationships in rural areas are fundamentally different from those in urban areas.

sentence: The first will consider community bank performance, with papers looking at the effect of financial derivatives on community bank profitability, the characteristics of community banks that recovered from significant financial distress, the effect of distance between merging banks on postmerger performance, and the determinants of differences in profitability across community banks.

sentence: The second session will consider issues of bank supervision and regulation, with papers discussing variations in the stringency of bank examination standards over time and their effect on lending, the effects of the Dodd-Frank Act on community banks, the relationship between community bank capital ratios and the likelihood of failure, and an approach for rationalizing bank supervision and regulation.
